properties.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 21 at 2:44AM PST until January 21 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding expected. Total tide peaking
between 11.0 and 11.5 feet.

* WHERE...Low lying areas of the south Washington coast.

* WHEN...Around the high tide between 9 AM and 11 AM PST today.

* IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above ground level,
during the 10 AM high tide is expected in the low lying areas
near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal
rivers.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Similar conditions in the past have
resulted in minor flooding in Raymond and on HWY 101 near
South Bend.
properties.instruction:
A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is
expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert
for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and
property.

NWSheadline: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 11 AM PST THIS MORNING
